<meta name="twitter:description" content="The 67W53L is a 53mm (53-400 neck finish) Black continuous thread plastic cap with a .035" three-ply co-extruded polyethylene foam liner (F217 style). This closure is made of polypropylene (PP) plastic and fits our 53-400 vials, bottles, and jars. This plastic cap features a smooth top and a ribbed side. The ribbed-sided design allows for ease of use when removing the lid. The 3-ply foam liner is compatible with many substances and is great for general lining applications." />

<script>
    require([
        'jquery',
        'mage/mage'
    ], function($){
        $(document).on('keyup', '.related-custom-qty', function() {
            calculate();
        });

        $('.related-custom-qty').change(function() {
            calculate();
        });

        function calculate(){
            var ids = '';
            var qty_ids = '';
            $('.related-custom-qty').each(function(){
                var qty = parseFloat($(this).val());
                if( qty > 0 ){
                    $('#related-checkbox'+$(this).attr('rel')).attr('checked',true);

                    ids += $(this).attr('rel')+',';
                    qty_ids += $(this).attr('rel')+'-'+qty+',';
                }
                else{
                    $('#related-checkbox'+$(this).attr('rel')).attr('checked',false);
                }
            });
            $('#related-products-field').val(ids.slice(0, -1));
            $('#related-product-qty').val(qty_ids.slice(0, -1));
        }

        var dataForm = $('#related-product-form');
        dataForm.mage('validation', {});
    });


</script>

        <div class="value description-tab-container" >

                                              <div class="std">
                    The 67W53L is a 53mm (53-400 neck finish) Black continuous thread plastic cap with a .035" three-ply co-extruded polyethylene foam liner (F217 style). This closure is made of polypropylene (PP) plastic and fits our 53-400 vials, bottles, and jars. This plastic cap features a smooth top and a ribbed side. The ribbed-sided design allows for ease of use when removing the lid. The 3-ply foam liner is compatible with many substances and is great for general lining applications.                  </div>
                            
                                                            <div class="materials">
                        <h4>Cap Liner Type:</h4>
                        <div style="width:100%;margin-top:15px">
<div style="margin-bottom:8px"><strong>F-217® .035” 3-Ply Co-extruded Foam Liner Composition</strong><br />The F-217 liner is a three-ply co-extruded white liner consisting of a closed cell foam produced from low-density polyethylene (LDPE) faced with solid LDPE on both sides. The opaque white outer skins create a high-quality visual aesthetic. The inner foam core creates a compressible yet resilient product allowing it to create a good seal with the container. 3-ply foam liners have become the industry standard due to their all-purpose compatibility, resilient, compressible seal, cleanliness (no pulp dust) and economy. 3-ply liners are taste and odor resistant, and have a low moisture transmission rate, meaning they prevent moisture from entering the bottle and affecting products. (This liner does not create an airtight seal.)</div>
<div style="float:left;width:100%;max-width:285px">
<table style="width:100%;margin:15px 10px 0 10px">
<tr style="font-weight:bold"><td>Material</td><td>Standard</td><td>Metric</td></tr>
<tr style="border-top:1px solid #ccc"><td>LDPE - Solid</td><td>-</td><td>-</td></tr>
<tr style="border-top:1px solid #ccc"><td>LDPE - Foam</td><td>.035"</td><td>.889mm</td></tr>
<tr style="border-top:1px solid #ccc;margin-bottom:10px"><td>LDPE - Solid</td><td>-</td><td>-</td></tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="float:left;width:100%;max-width:265px"><img src="/media/img/liners/liner-035-3ply-foam.png" alt="F-217 .035 3-Ply Co-extruded Foam Liner" style="margin:0 auto;width:225px" /></div>
<div style="clear:both"></div>
</div>

                                                                    <div class="materials">
                                                    <h4>Material:</h4>
                                                <img src="/media/img/material/pp.jpg" width="90" height="90" alt="Polypropylene Plastic" style="float:right;margin:0 0 20px 20px"><strong>Polypropylene (PP)</strong> is a tough plastic that has good chemical resistance. PP is translucent in its natural state but can have a glossy finish when produced with color. Some examples of common products made with PP are dairy and medication containers. Polypropylene is suitable for hot fill applications of up to 165°F and is therefore great for autoclaving. It is not recommended for cold or sub-freezing temperatures. The Cary Company has an assortment of polypropylene plastics available for purchase, such as plastic caps and jars, which have a higher tolerance for chemical products.                    </div>
